thread.title: Escaped: S.F. Brewers Guild celebrates aboard the S.S. Jeremiah O’Brien
thread.title_full: Escaped: S.F. Brewers Guild celebrates aboard the S.S. Jeremiah O’Brien

title: Escaped: S.F. Brewers Guild celebrates aboard the S.S. Jeremiah O’Brien
text:
October 16, 2015 Escaped: S.F. Brewers Guild celebrates aboard the S.S. Jeremiah O’Brien The San Francisco Brewers Guild hosts Brews on the Bay on Saturday, Oct. 24. Kassie Borreson kassieborreson.com i San FranciscoBerkeleyCarmelOaklandEurekaFresno 
The San Francisco Brewers Guild celebrates another year of beer on Saturday, Oct. 24, with a selection of brews offered aboard the historic World War II-era Liberty ship S.S. Jeremiah O’Brien. 
More than 60 brands of beerfrom dozens of Bay Area breweries, including Anchor Brewing Co. and Fort Point Beer Co., will be available. 
Brewers will be on hand to pour and offer insight. 
The event, held right off Pier 45, will also feature views of the Golden Gate Bridge, live music and local food pairings to accompany the selection of craft beers. Attendees must be 21 years or older. 
Tickets cost $55 per person, and include unlimited 8-ounce pours and food. For more information, visit sfbrewersguild.org . Florence and the Machine concert 

What: Florence and the Machine make their stops for two nights at UC Berkeley’s Greek Theatre with full lineups from their newest album, “How Big, How Blue, How Beautiful.” 
When: 8 p.m. Wednesday and Thursday, Oct. 21-22 
Where: Hearst Greek Theatre, 2001 Gayley Road, Berkeley 
Cost: Ticket prices vary based on availability International film festival 

What: The seventh annual Carmel International Film Festival will host film viewings, a live musical entertainment lounge, dinner parties, award ceremonies and speakers for filmmakers and movie enthusiasts alike. 
When: Wednesday to Sunday, Oct. 21-25 
Where: Downtown Carmel-By-The-Sea, Carmel
